TopicTitle: Development of a new Indie game

Articles.Content:
Hello KSP community!

I have recently started developing a new Unity game and I need further ideas and possible collaborators, so I have setup a google survey. If you could, please fill it out, as it will give me valuable information on how to manage this project. Please keep the responses serious and informative.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1zIUha0YQvGXSAI2xZzfxOof4AZmIu1cJIEwGoc3AzNw/viewform?usp=send_form

You shouldn't make a game for the sake of just making a game, you should do it because you have an idea or concept or gameplay mechanic that you want to see made. Having the community decide everything for you is a recipe for a terrible result. Develop an idea yourself, refine it, try to see if it stands on its own merits, and only then inquire for feedback.

Not trying to knock your first effort, just want to give a bit of a do-and-don't list to help you start off.
I've filled in the form, I might be able to help with a few things, as stated.
I'm a terrible modeler and have never written a line of code, but if you're making a game as practice, I might be able help you with the storyline.

I filled out the form, and i would love to help you with video editing my only problem is that my computer is so slow it can't record very high quality videos.

Luckly i probably have some computers i can loan which may be able to record stuff much better.
No offense, but the poll looks suspiciously like Game Dev Tycoon's things. Exact categories as well...
